header.title: THE POWERFUL AND DEADLY SPELLS OF THE JAVANESE

central_thesis: This book presents a collection of 'original' Javanese spells, alongside others from Malay, Iban, Arabic, and Chinese traditions, collected and personally verified by the author and his mediumistic father. It asserts that these spells, when performed precisely in their untranslated forms, constitute 'pure magical methods' capable of directly controlling and influencing supernatural forces to achieve a wide range of practical outcomes, including love, wealth, health, protection, and even destructive actions against enemies, thereby offering profound spiritual and material fulfillment.

structure_content.summary: The author introduces the book's content, stating that the spells were gathered from his father (a medium and healer) and extensive research in Borneo. He emphasizes that the book focuses on 'pure magical methods' and 'right invocations' for controlling supernatural forces, downplaying psychic phenomena. A key principle is that spells must be performed precisely, without alteration or translation, to maintain effectiveness. The book promises 'tremendous and intensifying exposure of wealth, health and self-satisfaction' to the practitioner.

This section details spells designed to attract love, regain a lost partner, and enhance personal desirability. It includes the 'KING AJASMORO LOVE SPELL' from Java, described as an 'invocation' ('pujaan'), which involves invoking 'ground/dark forces' and reciting a spell to bring a desired person to the caster. An 'Attraction spell' ('hikmat menarik') is also provided to make the caster radiate 'magnetic pulls' and attract attention.

A powerful and 'merciless' spell from Iban tribes in Borneo intended to sexually 'turn-on' and induce desire in a target, even against their initial will. The spell involves a specific physical action (rubbing the thumb while murmuring) linked to the target's anatomy and is recited repeatedly until a response is observed. A counter-attack spell is also provided for victims of such magic.

This part presents simple healing spells derived from Indian, Chinese, and Arabic sources, used by Javanese magicians ('Tuk Pawang'). Spells are given for instantly curing headaches, toothaches (by writing on paper and inserting), insomnia (by recitation or wearing a written talisman), and pain from any part of the body. A 'stop-bleeding' spell of Chinese origin is detailed, involving recitation, specific gestures, and patching a wound with a charmed material. A unique spell for melting bones stuck in the throat is also included.

structure_content.chapter_title: SPELLS THAT INFLUENCE OTHERS; BRING WEALTH & FORTUNE
structure_content.summary: This chapter offers spells to achieve promotion, recognition, good luck, wealth, peace, and harmony. Methods include writing spells on copper foil to attract good fortune or hanging written spells in the house. A spell to invite and secure the 'holy spirit's favour' for wish fulfillment is described. Additionally, techniques to gain 'upper-hand' in transactions, influence others, and soften a boss's heart ('Ilmu Kasihan' or Sympathetic magic) are provided, often involving written talismans on specific materials or breath-based spells.

This section covers diverse practical spells, including identifying a thief (by enchanting food), protecting premises from pests (by recitation), and safeguarding oneself during sleep from 'demons, astral spirits or 'passing' curses' (by recitation). A spell for good luck and success before leaving the house and an 'excellent spell' for taming animals are also detailed.

This chapter delves into 'black magic' spells described as 'merciless and very deadly.' These spells aim to cause harm, such as sleepless nights, nightmares (the 'Disturbing Spell'), fear ('tiger-look' spell), and even constant 'stoning' of a nuisance neighbor's house. The section culminates with a 'deadliest spell,' a 'soul-catching' curse, which is said to cause shivering, vomiting, paralysis, insanity, and even death, potentially dooming the soul eternally. Safety precautions against rebounding curses are also discussed.

key_concepts.definition: The system's fundamental approach, emphasizing direct engagement and control over supernatural forces through specific ritual actions and invocations, with minimal reliance on 'psychic phenomena'.

The crucial principle that spells must be performed precisely as given, without any alteration, shortening, simplification, or translation, to maintain their full inherent effectiveness. Any deviation diminishes potency.
A Javanese term referring to the act of calling upon specific forces or spirits, as exemplified in the King Ajasmoro Love Spell to summon 'ground/dark forces'.

Supernatural entities invoked in love spells, whose presence is indicated by physical sensations like cold breezes or feelings of being watched, and which are believed to assist in manifesting desires.
A specific Javanese spell designed to imbue the practitioner with 'magnetic pulls' that naturally attract the attention and admiration of others, particularly the opposite sex.
A powerful and 'merciless' spell intended to instantly generate intense sexual desire in a target, compelling them towards the caster, even overcoming initial reluctance.
Traditional Javanese practitioners of magic, sorcerers, or witch-doctors, who are presented as the custodians and practitioners of the healing spells documented in the book.

A category of 'merciless and very deadly' spells primarily targeting enemies, described as working directly on the victim's soul or through 'spirit intermediaries' (familiar spirits) to inflict various forms of harm, ranging from mild disturbance to death and eternal spiritual doom.
The most potent and deadly curse presented, intended to 'sumpah' (curse) an enemy's soul to eternal doom. It is claimed to cause immediate physical and mental collapse, and ultimately, death.

A Malay magical practice aimed at influencing others, specifically to soften hearts, reverse obstinate behavior, control emotions, and sway opinions for personal advantage, often involving breath-based transmission.

A strict rule or taboo in certain spell workings, specifically the prohibition against disclosing one's magical practices or intentions to others until the desired outcome has materialized. Violation leads to rejection of wishes and loss of spirit assistance.
Spells or written amulets (e.g., on paper, cloth, or deer's skin) used for personal safety, warding off malevolent entities (demons, astral spirits), curses, bad luck, and physical harm.

practical_system.description: The practical system presented is a results-oriented, formulaic approach to magic, emphasizing the precise execution of spells, invocations, and talismanic practices. It functions on the premise that specific words (often untranslated and presented in their original languages) and accompanying ritual actions directly manipulate supernatural forces to achieve desired outcomes. The practitioner's internal state is secondary to the faithful adherence to instructions, although 'emotions and desires' are sometimes mentioned as contributing factors. The system incorporates written charms, oral incantations, specific gestures, and designated times/locations for various workings.
tools: Dog tears (optional for clairvoyant vision of forces)
Match-stick, cigarette, or cylindrical object (for counter-sex spell)
Tiny piece of paper (for toothache spell, protection spell)
Glass of water (for insomnia, bone melting, demon possession spells)
Nail or ball-point pen (for writing on copper foil)
Piece of yellow cloth (for disturbing spell, neighbor nuisance spell, demon possession spell)
Red ink (for demon possession spell talisman)
Small piece of cloth from a virgin's shirt/dress (for influence/success spell)
'Rack' (piece of cloth used for censing clothes; for holy spirit spell talisman)
rituals: KING AJASMORO LOVE SPELL: Stand at front door/garden on a Friday night, take a deep breath, 'clap' the ground 7 times with the right hand to call upon 'ground/dark forces'. Recite the Javanese spell: 'Hai, Ratu Ajasmoro Turunlah bersama air mata Siti Fatimah Kuseru namamu membantu-ku Kembalikan roh ........(person's name) Kasih kepada-ku.' Follow by repeating the person's name and mother's name 3x and asking them to come home.

Attraction Spell ('hikmat menarik'): Before stepping out of the main door, recite 'Pucuk pinang selera pinang Mari ditanah dijari ma-nis Duduk ren-dang berdiri ren-dang Aku juga yang dipan-dang ma-nis' (3x).

JAVA SEX SPELL (hikmat ber-zina): Sit undetected, rub thumb slowly and forcefully with index finger, murmuring: 'When I rub my thumb I am in fact rubbing the clitoris (penis) of that girl (boy) .........(her name or the colour of dress if stranger). Let her show her love to me Let her show her desire to me Nang pa bunang Pa bunang ali menga-li Ra-gi pun tun-duk Ra-ji pun tun-duk Dengan ber-kat doa aku Lailahai illallah.' Recite repeatedly until the target shows signs of response.
Sex Spell Counter-attack: Obtain a match-stick/cigarette or similar cylindrical object. Say 'Bismillaahir Rohmaanir Rohim' (3x) and 'I break your spell.' Then break the object in two.

Headache Cure: Recite 'Bismillaahi khoirul asmaa' Bismillaahi robbul ardli wassamaa', Bismillaahil ladzismuhuu barokatuw wasyifaa', Bismillaahil ladzii biyadihisy syifaa', Bismillaahil ladzii laa yadlurru ma' asmihii syai-un fil ardli walaa fis samaa-i wahuwas samii' ul 'aliim.' (3x).
Toothache Cure: Write 'Likulli naba-im mustaqor wasaufa ta 'lamuun.' on a tiny piece of paper, fold it, and slide it into the affected teeth, clenching lightly.

Insomnia/Good Rest: Method 1: Recite 'Fanaadaa fidzhdzhulu-maati allaa ilaaha illaa anta subhaanaka innii kuntu minadzhdzhooli-miin, Fastajaabnaa lahu wanajjainaahu minal ghommi wa kadzaalika nunjil mu-miniin.' (3x) over a glass of water and drink before retiring. Method 2: Write the same spell on deer's skin and tie it to the waist every night before bed.

Pain Relief: Write 'Fanaadaa fidzhdzhulu-maati allaa ilaaha illaa anta subhaanaka innii kuntu minadzhdzhooli-miin, Fastajaabnaa lahu wanajjainaahu minal ghommi wa kadzaalika nunjil mu-miniin.' at midnight for 3 continuous nights.

Stop Bleeding: Fast for a period (not specified). Recite 'Innamaa yastajiibul ladziina yasma' uuna wal mautaa yab' atsuhu-mulloohu tsumma ilaihi yurja' uun.' (3x) before retiring. Operative part: Face east, hold cloth/leaf in left hand, form a 'sword' shape with right index and middle fingers, recite aloud specific Chinese words ('chze chzau yan mhau sunn sze ng mhei son yaw shazt hhoih'), then continue with 'Thai seong loww kuan, tao kheh ngau, sau chhap phowh kim, chamn wong hhor, wheng pbut lauu.' Make a circular motion (3x clockwise) with pointed fingers on the material, ending with a dot in the center. Patch and bandage the wound.

Melt Bone in Throat: Face east, support a glass of water with three left-hand fingers (thumb, index, middle), recite aloud specific Chinese words ('chze chzau yan mhau sunn sze ng mhei son yaw shazt hhoih'), then 'Yhee kwai fharr.' Dip right index and middle fingers lightly on the water surface, then drink the water.

Disturbing Spell (for enemies): Obtain a piece of cloth/shirt belonging to the enemy. Write 'Kadzaalika yathba' ulloohu 'alaa quluubil ladziina laa ya' lamuun.' on it. Facing the enemy's direction, recite the same spell (3x) every night. The spell is broken by burning the cloth.

Tiger-Look Spell (for frightening enemies): Recite 'Alloohul ghoolibu alloohul qoohiru, mudzillu kulli jabaarin 'aniid, nasshirul haqqi haitsu biyadihil, haulu wal quwwatu wassulthoon.' when the enemy is approaching.

Neighbor Nuisance Spell: Write 'Falammaa jaa-a amrunaa ja 'alnaa 'aaliya haa saafila-haa wa amtharnaa 'alaihaa hijaaratan min sijiilin mandluund. Musawwamatan 'inda rabika wamaa hiya minadzhdzhoolmiina biba 'iid.' on a piece of yellow cloth and bury it in the neighbor's premises, preferably near their bedroom.

Wealth/Fortune/Influence Spell (Copper Foil): Obtain a 2"x4" copper foil. Write 'Robbanaa 'alaika tawakkalnaa wa-ilaika anabnaa wa-ilaikal mashir, Robbanaa laa taj' alnaa fitnatal lilladziina kafaruu waghfir lanaa robbanaa innaka antal' aziizul hakiim.' on it with a nail or ball-point pen. Keep it in a wallet. For promotion, read the spell (3x) before meeting a boss.

Wealth/Fortune/Influence Spell (Holy Spirit): Write 'Watammat kalimatu robbika shidqow wa 'adlaa, laa mubaddila likalimaatih, wahuwas samii' ul 'aliim.' on a piece of 'rack' (censing cloth) and keep in pocket or tie to waist. Additionally, at midnight, read 'Yaa robbi bihaqqi haadzihil-aayati ajib du' aaii yaa arhamar roohimiin.' (100x).

Influence/Success (Virgin's Cloth): Write 'Mayyasyfa' syafaa' atan hasanatay yakul lahuu nashiibum minhaa, wamay yasyfa' syafaa' atan sayyi-atay yakul lahuu kiflum minhaa wakaanalloohu 'alaa kulli syai-im muqiitaa.' on a small piece of cloth from a virgin's shirt or dress on a Friday morning when the sun is rising. Fold it and keep it in a wallet or tie around the waist.

Ilmu Kasihan (Sympathy Spell): Recite 'Laput Yu kata yu Aku anak wayang Allah Engkau yang mengata Aku Aku yang engkau ikut Berkat doa-ku Lailahai illallah.' (3x) and blow/exhale breath at the boss or enemy.

Good Business Spell: Recite 'Bismilah hirrahman nirrahim Patah pahat patah simpai patah lubuk mena-haya hati perut anak Adam dah ter-simpai mati dibunuh menang bicara Mulut bercakap mulut ter-simpai Lidah mengelitik lidah terkelu kaki bergerak kaki terkelu tangen bergerak tangan ter-simpai.'

Thief Identification Spell: Write 'Waidz qotaltum nafsan faddaro-tum fiihaa wallaahu mukhrijum maa kuntum taktumuun.' over bread or food, with the number of writings equal to the number of people in the house. Serve the food; the culprit will have difficulty swallowing.
Pest Extermination: Recite a specific (unspecified) spell (3x) for disposing of pests.

Protection (Sleeping Hours): Recite 'Sir wala sir wala Nubi Berail nama-nya dia Nur ganda nama-nya ibu Awal hadiat awal hakikat Malaikat dikiri aku Malaikat dikanan aku Malaikat itulah jadi kapit timbar badan-ku Malaikat itulah jadi gunung payung-ku Aku anak manikam Allah Aku diam didalam balun zat-tullah Berkat doa aku lailahai illallah.' before going to sleep.

Good Luck/Success (Leaving House): Stand at the front door, take a long-deep breath, look up at the sky for a few seconds, then look to the ground for a minute. Slowly look from toes/feet up to the chest. Recite 'Ila ku-mati Waila ku-mati Alif tiada mati' and walk 7 steps without turning back.

Animal Taming: Slowly corner the animal, chanting 'Hai tuk tandan ge-lombang perang Bukit ter-dinding didepan-ku Berat seperti batu Ter-baring didepan-ku Akuuuuuuu nilah harimau jantan Hulu-balang Allah diatas dunia ini Dengan berkat doa aku Lailahai illallah.' without looking into its eyes. After catching, gently fondle its neck and throat area.

This book teaches you the right invocations that deals directly with supernatural forces, and their effects are from the pure magical methods by which those forces can be controlled and influenced. Therefore, this book deals with very little psychic phenomena.
In this book, all spells are original with no alterations/shortened or simplified, and that is the main reason why I did not translate the words in the spells in order to preserve its effectiveness!
I personally guarantee the spells will work like miracles for you. You will never regret having this book! I quote:- miracles CAN be made to happen if you you know the right way to coax them!!!

This is a very, very powerful spell that when read will immediately "turn-on" the opposite sex and is also one of the merciless spells that will instantly urge your partner to bed with you even if they said 'NO' minutes before.

The Javanese have an extensive body of 'black magic', a reflection of one of their major interests. This 'black magic' works directly on the victim's soul or through spirit intermediaries, for example, 'familiar' spirits. The spells given here are actually merciless and very deadly.
Finally, here is the deadliest spell that I have ever come across and I personally do not recommend anybody to try it because it is too lethal and merciless. Getting to know it would be just fine.
If his aura and will are not penetrated by your spells, then it might rebound on you with even greater force! To ensure your own safety, you can take the following precautions:-

But there is one 'pantangan' (forbidden thing) and that is you must not tell anybody about what you're doing until you have been granted your wish, i.e. after obtaining whatever you seek earlier. critical_analysis.relevance: This book serves as a valuable primary document for understanding syncretic folk magic traditions in Southeast Asia, particularly the blend of Javanese, Malay, Iban, Arabic, and Chinese influences. It directly addresses the operative side of magic, providing explicit instructions for a wide array of practical goals, from personal enhancement to severe curses, a perspective often marginalized in more academic occult studies. The author's insistence on 'originality' and untranslated spells highlights a common belief in the intrinsic power of linguistic forms in traditional magic, offering insight into the preservation and perceived efficacy of such formulas. Its inclusion of 'black magic' provides a stark, unapologetic view into the darker, often ethically challenging, aspects of practical spellcraft, contrasting with more sanitized occult literature.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is the practitioner seeking direct, tangible results through magical means, especially those interested in the folk traditions of Southeast Asia. This includes individuals aspiring to gain love, wealth, influence, healing, and protection, as well as those willing to engage with 'deadly' or 'merciless' spells against enemies. The text also appeals to enthusiasts of grimoire traditions and practical spell manuals. Additionally, researchers in anthropology, ethnomagicology, and comparative occultism would find it relevant for understanding operative magical systems and cultural syncretism, albeit with the understanding that the author's claims of efficacy are presented from a practitioner's perspective rather than academic verification.
